docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said it would terminate health insurance for 115,000 people on Oct. 1 because they had failed to prove they were eligible for coverage.

headline.main: U.S. to End Coverage Under Health Care Law for Tens of Thousands
headline.print_headline: U.S. to End Coverage Under Health Care Law for Tens of Thousands

docs.abstract: Obama administration plans to terminate health insurance for 115,000 people on Oct 1, 2014, for failing to prove that they are United States citizens or legal immigrants eligible for coverage under the Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration said it would terminate health insurance for 115,000 people on Oct. 1 because they had failed to prove they were eligible for coverage.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The country should welcome innovative health devices but should also pass legislation to protect individual privacy.
docs.abstract: Editorial warns that most of the medical and personal information collected by Apple's new smartwatch and similar devices is not protected by federal privacy laws; contends while Apple is taking admirable steps to shore up privacy, no amount of caution can take the place of strong privacy laws that give consumers control over how data companies collect their information, and to whom it is sold.
docs.snippet: The country should welcome innovative health devices but should also pass legislation to protect individual privacy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Russell Pearce, who had been a polarizing figure on the immigration issue, said he was quoting someone else in calling for birth control for those getting Medicaid.

headline.main: Arizona Republican Official Resigns After Remarks About Medicaid Recipients
headline.print_headline: Arizona Republican Official Resigns After Remarks About Medicaid Recipients

docs.abstract: Former Arizona State Sen Russell Pearce resigns as Arizona Republican Party's first vice chair amid criticism for remarks he made supporting mandatory birth control or sterilization for Medicaid recipients.
docs.snippet: Russell Pearce, who had been a polarizing figure on the immigration issue, said he was quoting someone else in calling for birth control for those getting Medicaid.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York's attorney general filed a federal lawsuit Monday seeking to stop a manufacturer from discontinuing its drug widely used to treat Alzheimer's patients, arguing the company is illegally driving patients to its newer patented drug to avoid losses from cheaper generic alternatives coming out next year.
